JobFullDesc: Since 1992, Ciena has been driven by a relentless pursuit of network innovation.  We believe in a network that grows smarter, more agile, and more responsive every day. This means that when you digitally interact in your world - picking up the phone, streaming video, texting a friend or loved one – your interactions are being enabled by Ciena technologies.  Ciena makes your social / entertainment / business existence REAL.This position can be located anywhere in the United StatesAs a senior leader in the Global Partner Organization, the Global Partner Alliances Director will develop and deliver comprehensive and actionable partnerships and alliances strategies, will work with existing and new ecosystem partners to grow Ciena presence in the marketplace, will create repeatable and scalable engagement models with our partners that will drive incremental revenue through partnership and alliance programs.You will define and drive go-to-market (GTM) plans with key strategic partners as well as inform our product development roadmap by advocating for the potentially most impactful integrations and technical partnerships to our internal stakeholders in product and engineering teams.You will effectively communicate Ciena’s value proposition, vision, and capabilities to existing and potential new partners.You will work closely with our Sales teams to ensure productive engagement with partners, while achieving and exceeding assigned revenue/referral targets as well as other objectives.You will introduce/educate existing and potential partners to new Ciena solutions as they evolve.You will become an expert and a go-to-resource on Ciena partnerships and alliances in the Ciena Partner Network, stakeholders, and internal colleagues alike.We are a small but very focused team that views itself as vital to growing Ciena’s customer base and market share.We are looking for an experienced and insightful, "hands-on" GTM leader who can help us scale our business. This position will be a key contributor within Ciena and your role will be both highly visible as well as vital to our overarching Adaptive Network growth strategy.You will have our commitment to work with you directly to develop your skills, advance your career, and make an impact along the way.What you will accomplish:Establish a comprehensive and actionable partnership GTM program that encompass at least three discrete, even if closely interconnected, aspects:1) Alliance partnerships (product integrations, connections, API strategy, informed roadmap, sell through)2) GTM partnerships (including co-selling partners, Solution providers and other channel partners etc.)3) Consulting / Integration partnerships (strategic integration and IT consulting companies, Global Systems Integrators)The role would also encompass continuous evaluation of the ecosystem of companies either effectively competing or complementing our product offering for potential deeper partnership or M&A opportunities. Define success metrics and execute on achieving agreed upon partnership program metrics / KPI's / milestones including but not limited to: Activity monitoring: ongoing monitoring of number of touch points with different partners, execution of partner QBR's, number of new partnership and alliance agreements etc., Result monitoring, including pipeline generated, pipeline affected, revenue touched (by partners), revenue driven directly by Ciena Partner Network partners. Run effective cross-functional sales, product and marketing meetings providing an informed view to develop and execute partnership and alliance-centric programs, impactful revenue generating strategies, partner enablement and marketing deliverables.Role Expectations:* Work with Ciena executive team to develop global business development strategy and operational practices* Create, develop and lead a scalable and global Ciena + Blue Planet Technical Alliance and Integration programs to enhance network agility and digital transformation for existing and future customers* Partner with technology businesses from start-up to established technology leaders to enhance the Ciena hardware and software solution portfolio* Develop Channel-led GTM strategies and programs with Technical Alliance and Integration partners, including financial models, joint value proposition, sales enablement collateral, demand generation and field training.* Identify pilot Ciena Partner Network “pilot” partners for early access training/enablement, marketing and field programs to incubate channel programs before global roll-out* Develop channel sales programs, including joint selling, meet-in-the-channel and selling through the Technical Alliance partner’s channel to create a broader solution capability beyond Ciena core offeringsRequirements:* 10-15+ years experience in-partner/alliance business development, GTM strategies, programs, product marketing experience* Excellent consulting skill set, including discovery, analysis, modeling, communication and project leadership skills* Must be comfortable leading executive level strategy discussions as well as facilitating technical discussions with engineers and developers* Experience leading workshops and/or facilitating meetings with multilevel internal and customer audiences* Proven ability to develop and implement complex programs and achieve required results* Strong networking hardware and software experience and the ability to think strategically about driving both software and hardware opportunities forward* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills* Drive and motivation to take on
